alert.note: Alert for McCreary; Pulaski; Wayne (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 09 at 8:07PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Wayne, southern Pulaski and northeastern McCreary Counties through 845 PM EST... At 807 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Parnell, or near Monticello, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Monticello, Naomi, Mill Springs, Steubenville, Betsey and Frazer around 810 PM EST. Bronston, Kidder, Delta and Quinton around 815 PM EST. Somerset, Burnside, Tateville, Pulaski County Park, General Burnside S.P., Sloans Valley, Elihu and Somerset Pulaski Airport around 820 PM EST. Alpine and Ruth around 825 PM EST. Other locations in the path of this storm include Grade, Dykes, Mount Victory and Bent. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Kentucky Highway 80 in Pulaski County between mile markers 17 and 31. Louis B. Nunn Parkway MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in JACKSON KY. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until midnight EST for south central Kentucky.
